Useful

Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/13/2017
I have been living here for about a month now, and I love it. This is the third apartment I've lived in in Durham so far, and it is by far the best. It's in a great area with lots of places to shop at (it's right beside Kroger!) and there is also a walking path to the nearby park, which I enjoy. It is a quiet community and I rarely hear my neighbors, which is a nice change from what I'm used to dealing with. I feel safe here, and as a woman living alone, that means a lot. The apartment itself is beautiful, and all the appliances in the kitchen were new. There is plenty of storage space, and the patio is very roomy. I have had no real complaints living here so far. It's a bit pricey, but worth it.
I have been living here for about a month now, and I love it. This is the third apartment I've lived in in Durham so far, and it is by far the best. It's in a great area with lots of places to shop at (it's right beside Kroger!) and there is also a walking path to the nearby park, which I enjoy. It is a quiet community and I rarely hear my neighbors, which is a nice change from what I'm used to dealing with. I feel safe here, and as a woman living alone, that means a lot. The apartment itself is beautiful, and all the appliances in the kitchen were new. There is plenty of storage space, and the patio is very roomy. I have had no real complaints living here so far. It's a bit pricey, but worth it. Read less

Report
Resident
2013 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/10/2016
Overall, this is a decent place to live. The community is quiet (unless you live near the pool) and I don't think there is a high crime rate (Minus a few car break ins). Some pros: maintenance guys are great, quiet community. Cons: The manager in the office is not personable at all. The apartments are very small. You are REQUIRED to pay an extra 50 dollars a month for cable that is useless (I will get to that in a minute) and there is inconsistency in how rules are enforced. Inconsistency- management will send out passive aggressive reminders about your lease obligations etc., but then they allow others to make this place look like trash. Example- in one building the tenants has decorated the outside of their deck with silk flowers. Yes, I said silk flowers...it looks terrible. Oh yea, they have decorated the walkway outside their door with them as well- to add insult to injury they even added a plastic fence. They also put bubble wrap around the railing of their deck ....yes, bubble wrap. In addition, on their deck they have the following items...a vacuum (no, really) more bubble wrap, more ugly silk flowers, broken stools, stools that aren't broken, toys...it looks so trashy. Yet, no passive aggressive reminders to the community that you can't decorate your deck and the walkway with SILK flowers and you should probably not use your deck as storage since the complex gives you a pretty decent sized storage unit and you can rent a garage for pretty cheap. Colonial Grand...two words- DO BETTER. Cable- there has to be a LAW against this!! First off, if you think for one second that you are making out good by having this "included" (not really) in your rent then I am here to tell you that you are not. It is basic cable, and if you even watch TV a little bit you ARE going to have to call Time Warner Cable to get REAL cable. You cannot decline it. It is baked into your rent every month...like it or not. And, it's 50 dollars at that! I wonder if anyone has ever tried to contact someone about this. It is advertised as an amenity but, to me an amenity is something that I can enjoy as part of my residence (e.g., clubhouse, fitness center, pool) not another monthly payment for services I cannot even use! I would rather take 50 bucks and wipe my behind with it then to give it to you every month for something I do not use. Oh and the pool.... Where do I begin? Yet another passive email goes out about how you can only have one guest blah, blah, blah....NO ONE LISTENS TO YOU SO WHY DON'T YOU START INVESTIGATING THE PEOPLE THAT ABUSE THIS?????? You cannot get to a grill even if you wanted to. And someone has a party out there every single weekend...and they invite all their cousins, aunts, uncles, grandmas, baby daddies, sister in laws, brother in laws, neighbors from previous neighborhoods, co-workers...you name it. So, a little piece of advice....try actually addressing the problems head on. And try addressing the real problems and not the ones you think you've caught. ;) P.S.- Maintenance guys are the best!

Once i gave my notice that i was moving out they said they needed to â??pre inspectâ?? my apartment to make sure everything was fine. Thats funny maybe the one who need a pre inspection before i signed a lease was me since nothing was like it was promised. NEVER have i been asked for a pre inspection before i moved out anywhere i have rented. They charged me $225 for background check and other ridiculous fees. Yet the type of people that live hereâ?¦ well ill leave it to yalls imagination. Report
Resident
2009 - 2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/29/2014
I don't know where to start except to say that this place has truly turned into the ghetto. I was here for several years and just recently moved while I had the chance for fear that things could only get worse. For one, when I moved, I felt safe coming in at all hours of the night without question. The neighborhood seemed to be full of young professionals, just an all-around good crowd. My first year there was uneventful and satisfactory. However, it all went downhill after that. The neighbors who moved in were so loud and no matter how many complaints I made to the office, they did nothing about it. The neighbors would just say they weren't making any noise and the office took their word for it, without following up with me to let me know the outcome of addressing the issue. The "courtesy officer" is a joke because if you ever call him to help with noise, he just tells you to call 911. Isn't that what we have you in the complex for, to address issues like this? No, he was only good for hanging rent notices and other things on people's door, yet probably got a 50% discount on rent for doing absolutely nothing. Also, several apartments were broken into in broad daylight, as well as several cars. I know we were not notified of each of these occurrences as the office as an obligation to do. I know this because when I was leaving for work one morning, I saw a window busted out of an SUV in front of my building and I called the office to report this. I knew it belonged to a female neighbor of mine and asked them to notify her. I never heard another word about this. Speaking of notices, the office was notorious for writing notices with one date on them, yet the date they're placed on your door were about 7-10 days later than the notice was dated for. Many of these notices included information about them needing to enter your apt and on what date this would occur. However, almost always the case was that the visit didn't occur on the date they said. I would return home and could tell someone had entered my apt, yet no note left as to why which is what maintenance usually does when they've entered. When I would ask the office about it, they would remind me of the notice that was left on the door about a WEEK earlier. Ok, ONE notice on my door specifying a day someone is coming into my apt does not give you free range to come into my apt a WEEK later without notice. As far as parking, you literally had to race people home from work in order to get a good spot where you didn't feel your car would be vandalized or broken into. Yes, they have garages, but I think a reasonable expectation is that you have a decent place to park without having to pay more on top of your rent. I would never leave my apt again once I got home because I didn't feel safe coming back after dark and not having a parking space. Over the years, the demographics started changing for the worse when the management turned over and Marsha left. Everything went down the drain after that. They must have been desperate for residents after that because the demographics started to get sketchy then. I had new neighbors that I couldn't even tell you who actually lived there because at any given time there were about 15-20 people in the apt at any given time. They would leave their door wide open all day every day, so you had to walk past their open door in order to get downstairs. It was so weird. I could smell marijuana coming from their apt even with the door closed. I also noticed that they changed their doorknob to have one with a lock on it; everyone else's has the typical doorknob with no lock and you use your deadbolt to lock the door. This was super sketchy to me, made me wonder what was going on in that apt! The condition of the apartments were also another story. My first year, I had brand new carpet in my apt, it was freshly painted, and the appliances were in working order. However, when I changed apts, it was a joke. My carpet was stained from the previous resident's pet, it was no dingy. It was clearly time for it to be changed, but since they are always looking for ways to cut corners, this apparently wasn't on their list of improvements before I moved in. The appliances are archaic to say the least. The bulbs were burned out in the microwaves. The dishwashers were way smaller than the space they were shoved into, leaving a nasty gap that showed between the cabinets. The buildings are so old that the plumbing is also a joke. Every time I flushed my toilet, there was a loud noise afterwards that sounded like a train coming by that lasted for about 15 seconds. This was seriously so loud that if I had guests over for the weekend, it would wake anyone up in the other room. There was clearly a leak somewhere because my water bill got higher and higher from month to month until it eventually reached almost $100 before I moved out! One person does not use $100 worth of water in one month! Before changing apartments, my bill would be about $19-$23. Speaking of the water bill, get ready for hidden fees if you move here. Somehow they sneak something in every month or raise the pest fee or something else so it's added on to your water. The company (AUM) who manages the water bill will itemize this for you, so compare it to your previous months bills if you don't believe me. Also, when I first moved to CG, I could bring my own washer and dryer. However, when I changed apartments, their new "policy" was that the washer and dryer was included in the apt which means that they would add $50 on the rent every month. How does it make sense to make me not bring my own W&D from my apt just to switch apts, and then charge me $50 more a month for it? Finally, they let me keep my own washer and dryer but only after putting up a fit for it. The office is unorganized and don't know what's going on half the time. They lose anything you give them and then hound you for other copies; kind of scary to wonder where my identifying information is floating around. Maintenance doesn't really fix things, they will find the shortest possible shortcut that doesn't cost money rather than really fixing anything. Also, people leave their pet bags of feces all around the community. Good luck checking your mailbox without smelling dog poop because people will use the mailbox trash to dispose of this even though there's a notice that says not to use that trash can for disposal of pet waste. If you ever have an issue with the office, you better go straight to corporate in Texas rather than contact Regional in Charlotte if you want any action. The people in Charlotte are just as clueless and will provide absolutely no assistance. Yes, this place is convenient to shopping and restaurants, but know this comes at a price, which is crime and unsavory characters as your neighbors. Also know that there is a "tent city" in the woods beside the complex. This is well-known to most people in Durham/Chapel Hill. This place is full of homeless people who roam through the woods with their dogs and shotguns, which you can hear at all hours of the night. There are plenty of other communities that are NEWER and offer a greater value and SAFETY than this place.

Resident
2012 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/03/2013
I've lived happily at Colonial Grand at Patterson Place for one year. My 1400 SF 3 bedroom, 2 bath apartment is very comfortable. I'm on the top floor at the back of the property facing the woods so I have great privacy and it's very quiet. Parking is never a problem. I have a garage (at $25/month, why not!) but mostly use it for storage and occasionally park in it so my car doesn't frost up on cold days. The staff has been very friendly and cooperative. Maintenance has promptly taken care of the few minor issues I've had. I gave it 4 stars rather than 5 only because a little painting is needed in a few places around the complex and there's some minor wear in the apartment. Overall, a great place to live in an ideal location near 15/501 and I-40 and around the corner from tons of shopping and restaurants.

Resident
2010 - 2012 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/26/2013
We lived at the residence for 2 years. The first year was fine and you got what you paid for. As soon as the staff turned over, everything went down the drain. They staff were rude know-it-alls every time you had to interact with them. During our stay we met quite a few other residents. Most of which had dogs. About 5 of those dog owners within 2 weeks had to take their dogs to the vet for symptoms of vomit and diarrhea. The vet stated they must have picked something up outside. We made the connection that the lack of waste bags (we counted 4 weeks without replacing them) and dog waste laying around the property was affecting the dogs. Also, one day in the summer while laying out at the pool we noticed 2 large piles of dog waste INSIDE The pool area. Disgusting. We helped a friend move into the apts and while we were moving things in we discovered cat waste above a cabinet that was never cleaned and the apt smelled of smoke and this was supposed to a "smoke free" apt. The garbage dumps were constantly overflowing and garbage flying around the property. Other tenants would leave their dog waste bags at the door or in the parking lots for days, and when we complained they did absolutely NOTHING until we raised our voices with them and called the main office in Texas and the Dept of Health. We had another friend have water damage from the apt above which went untreated for so long they had to move out and stay in a hotel (and never got reimbursed). Some areas of the apt had no parking and had to park in areas without spots. I could hear people above and below us numerous times just talking! We had our neighbor right next to us have their place broken into during the middle of the day! Very scary. We would not recommend a young single female to move in here. Check out spotcrime.com and you will see why. For our 3rd year lease it went up to over $830/mo without any pet rent. For a friend who lived there and had to complain more often than we did, she had pet rent added to her new lease! SHADY! When we were selling out washer/dryer the person picking them up stated that our water heater was about the burst "any second"! We've lived in 4 other apt complexes across the US and this was by far the worst. So much for southern hospitality! We rarely right bad reviews, but this one was so bad we had to share our story so others won't have to experience this as well.

Nice apartment, great location. Management/maintenance issues. Was told unit would be cleaned and painted before move-in. Painting was "touch-up" only. Cleaning, if any other than from previous resident, was limited to what could be seen standing in a room. Layers of dust on everything above eye level (tops of door, frames, cabinets). Washer rusted, dryer corner taped together. After 3 requests they sanded rust in washer and touched up with appliance enamel. Now the rust is smooth and the sanded rust is in the bottom of the washer. Biggest irritation is management's refusal to acknowledge the obvious. For example, I showed management rust marks and bathmat stains in bathtub. Management said this is to be expected in a 13 yr old complex. After 10 minutes with a sponge and cleanser the tub looked almost new. I again showed it to management who refused to acknowledge it looked any different. The carpet is worn and stained. Management says it looks fine. It's a puzzlement. There seems to be one maintenance guy for the entire complex. He is prompt and courteous. I believe he is limited by substandard materials and management's obvious desire to save money at all costs. The complex is only 13 yrs old and has potential to be a very nice property for many years to come. Unfortunately it is being poorly maintained and already shows signs of substandard housing.

2009 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/12/2011
After living at CG for another year, I wanted to update my review but decided to leave my old review below. After I wrote my last review, we moved into a 2 bedroom apt in a different building in the complex. For the most part, we are still happy. Good things: - Top floor apts have very few bugs, nice size balcony with the 2 bedroom - SPACE. Two bedroom is quite large, all of our stuff fits, and there are 2 storage rooms - Maintenance has continued to respond promptly. They don't always do the best job in the world, but we haven't had any major unaddressed issues - I think they are doing some small renovations to apts when people move out, so there will be some updated things Bad things: - When it comes time to renew they WILL raise your rent $50 - $70 a month; count on it [I realize there are often rent increases, but this seems high to me and when rent goes up but you aren't making any more money it can be frustrating] - Pool and gym are inconsistent. There is always some machine that doesn't work in the gym, there are NEVER paper towels to clean off the equipment. The pool has been closed some this year and just recently I was at the pool while an environmental health guy was checking the water. He recommended not to swim bc he didn't detect enough chlorine in the water, even though the complex had just refilled the pool the week before and said they were ready to be checked...yuck. - The air conditioning units in these apartments are loud (I have noticed this in friends' apts as well) We have been pretty happy here, but are considering moving because of the cost...I would (mostly) recommend. ___________________10/2011_________________ My husband and I have been at Colonial Grand at Patterson Place in a 1 bedroom, 3rd floor apartment for the past two years. Overall, the experience has been a good one. Any time we have needed maintenance (a broken bathroom towel rod, refrigerator quit working, broken disposal) the problems were fixed immediately (within ~12 hours) although the towel rod patch was a little shotty. I haven't interacted with the front staff much (they got rid of some of the less desirables recently) but I have a favorable opinion of the new staff thus far. I am a Master's student so it was important to me that the apartments were quiet - it is quiet up on the 3rd floor, I can't say about other floors. I really love our apartment (its 900 square feet) and all of the friends that I have had visit have been impressed. I have hosted several pool parties/cookouts in the pool area and there has typically been space for me to have several friends hang out. Parking can be a little iffy late at night, but I don't mind walking (it's good for you!). Also, there were some car break-ins in the first year that I lived here (my husband's car was one of them) but I haven't heard about much lately. They posted a police car ( I think, maybe he's a resident?) near the pool house which has helped with break ins in our area. The apartments are definitely pricey, but we have been happy. There are a lot of restaurants and small shopping centers nearby and you can walk to Kroger from the complex. I hope this has been helpful and happy apartment hunting!
After living at CG for another year, I wanted to update my review but decided to leave my old review below. After I wrote my last review, we moved into a 2 bedroom apt in a different building in the complex. For the most part, we are still happy. Good things: - Top floor apts have very few bugs, nice size balcony with the 2 bedroom - SPACE. Two bedroom is quite large, all of our stuff fits, and there are 2 storage rooms - Maintenance has continued to respond promptly. They don't always do the best job in the world, but we haven't had any major unaddressed issues - I think they are doing some small renovations to apts when people move out, so there will be some updated things Bad things: - When it comes time to renew they WILL raise your rent $50 - $70 a month; count on it [I realize there are often rent increases, but this seems high to me and when rent goes up but you aren't making any more money it can be frustrating] - Pool and gym are inconsistent. There is always some machine that doesn't work in the gym, there are NEVER paper towels to clean off the equipment. 2009 - 2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/16/2010
I recently moved out of Colonial Grand at Patterson Place and must say I have learned a number of things from my experience there. The main lesson I learned is to visit a complex at night to see the parking availability. Colonial Grand at Patterson Place had one of the worst parking situations I have ever experienced. If I returned to my apartment anytime after 8pm, there was a good chance I would be doing some walking from where I parked. Additionally the apartments themselves were not that nice and were old. My particular building looked somewhat rundown by the stairwells with the ceiling sagging in certain places. As far as the actual apartment itself, it was decent but nothing to right home about and certainly not worth the $900 /month we were paying to stay there. The appliances worked properly but the fact that there was no washer or dryer was a real negative for me. As far as positives, the fitness facility/clubhouse was pretty cool although the rental rates were ridiculous. Additionally the swimming pool was pretty nice although I never saw them drain the water so I would imagine they just shock it with chlorine. Overall I would not recommend this complex and would recommend you look elsewhere.

Our family has lived in a number of colonial properties, two of them being "grand" status. I have to say this is the worst. Please, please, please do not be lured in by their smiles and their fake attitude towards you, because once that lease is signed it is a whole different ball park. Well, we got our renewal letter with their "deals" and its funny that for another 12 month lease our rent would be an additional $160 a month!!!! Do not live here!!, even if the price you get in the beginning is awesome or you would be getting an apt. with a good view, whatever the case it will not be worth it. Resident
2007 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/01/2008
Upon initial review, Colonial Grand at Patterson Place looks pretty nice. The grounds border the New Hope Game Preserve, which provides a pretty backdrop from large porches (from the right units). It's "pet friendly"- more on that later. There is even a Kroger across the street. DON'T BE FOOLED. The problems with Colonial Grand occur after you sign your lease. The walls and floor are paper thin- if someone around has a moderate stereo, your apartment might shake, literally. The nails on your beloved porch slowly and consistently creep skyward, looking for a bare foot to cut; the roaches emerge in April and yes, there will be roaches. The 365 days/year hot tub has been turned off and full of leaves for the past 5 months. The weight room has also been closed for over a month. With the exception of the thundering noise, this would be acceptable (though you can find a better deal for the price). Remember, it's an apartment, not Shangri-La. We're friends with our neighbors and certainly could imagine worse places. The real problem with Colonial Grand at Patterson Place is the management. In the course of our 12 month lease, the entire management staff turned over and then replaced the rest of the employees. Gone are the friendly faces that used to greet us and the maintenance men that knew us by name. The new staff is concerned with one thing, getting more of your money. They'll smile, look you in the eye, and lie right to your face. They misappropriated our water bill (which was paid) and then passed on months of late payments to us. They swapped our refundable pet deposit with a pet fee and double-charged us for it. Oh, and review your lease carefully- their standard practice is to write an extra day in just to give you a final cash-jab to the ribs when it's time to leave. Thank God we didn't pay a security deposit- we would've kissed that money directly goodbye. If you decide to roll the dice, you can do worse than live here. Just be warned.

FOr at lleast a month after it was clear that these people were moved out trash continued to blow across the back courtyard, BUT it seems even though he was informed because it did not show on the front side of the property he didn't really care. On the same note I set a bag of trash outside of my door in order remember to take it over when I left in about 20 min and he admonished me for having it there. I asked him again right there about the Trash in the aformentioned apartment and he gave an angry, "It's being taken care of" which it wasn't for quite a while longer..<br><br>And most recently and perhaps the worst.<br><br>Today I got a notice on the door sometime between 11am and 2pm, Dated for today that tells the residents of three buildings that they will be painting TODAY and we need to have everything removed from our patios and not park out front due to overspray. They are soory for the short notice but this is going to be going on from 8am - 6:30 pm. The note was very poorly written and had so many confusing gramatical errors it was hard to read. But the point of it was that he put out a notice at least 3 hours after most people had already left for work, to let them know that he was not responsible for paint damage caused by his lack of notice. Negative four hours is not enough notice for this sort of thing.. How about a week!<br><br>A note to anyone from the colonial office that reads this far.. Change the office staff Marcus in particular and make sure they have a clue what they are doing.. Read less

Report
Resident
2006 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/10/2006
I went to Colonial at Patterson Place (previously North Creek) with hopes of renting a 1 bedroom apt and was told there were none available at that time, however, one would be available on April 7th. Since the management had no vacant 1-br to show me, they took me into the 2-br model, which was beautiful and well-maintained. Management informed me the 1-BR that would be available on April 7th was "even more amazing" than the model, so I took her at her word (BIG MISTAKE) and decided to take the apartment, sight unseen, based on the agent's "even more amazing apartment" comment. I then completed the application, gave the agent on site my $120 "fee", trusting the agent's recommendation that this was truly an "amazing" apt. The 1-br was vacated one day prior to my scheduled move-in date, so I stopped by on my lunch hour to take a look. I was extremely disappointed in the condition of the unit. It was poorly maintained, filthy, and in no way "amazing" as was described to me by the management. To the contrary, the appliances were dated, microwave surface cracked, and the stench was horrible. I told management I did not want the apartment and he continued to give me his sales pitch, asking what it was that I did not like about the apt and trying to nullify my every concern. I asked for a refund of my $120 "application fee" based on the fact that the agent misrepresented the condition of the apartment. The management refused to refund my money, but instead offered me a 2 bedroom, which I did not want, especially after witnessing the deceptiveness of the apartment staff. The one good thing that came out of this unpleasant experience was that I did not move into this complex and will not have to deal with deceptive management on a daily basis.

Resident
2000 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/12/2003
We´ve been pretty happy at Northcreek. We´ve lived here three years, while my wife was getting her Masters. <br><br> <br><br>The negatives: <br><br> <br><br>It´s expensive for this area. <br><br> <br><br>There was a rash of property crime in the complex last year, with a bunch of cars and apartments getting broken into. I know they have two cops living here now, but I´m not sure if that´s what stopped the crimes. <br><br>Maybe the crooks got caught somewhere else. <br><br> <br><br>The construction is a little weird--there´s not a straight line in our family room. The room layout of the family room/dining room thingy is odd; you have to think a bit about how to fit your furniture to use the nooks and spaces in the room. <br><br> <br><br>We´ve had ants a few times. They have an exterminator come in once a week, so I guess we´re not alone. (The ants all disappear after the exterminator sprays, for what it´s worth.) <br><br> <br><br>There are lots of dogs in the complex. If you are phobic about dogs, this is probably the wrong place to live. <br><br> <br><br>The positives: <br><br> <br><br>The maintenance people are *really* good. We´ve had a number of small problems, and a couple of bigger ones--they´ve always been helpful. At one point, we noticed that the guardrail on our patio was loose, and complained, and they got a welder out within a couple of days to repair it. We´ve called in maintenance complaints after hours before, and we´ve gotten quick responses. <br><br> <br><br>The grounds are nice. If you wonder where all that rent money goes, look around during the day, when there are ten people wandering around maintaining the lawn, bushes, buildings, etc. They also maintain the pool and the exercise room well. <br><br> <br><br>The apartments are also pretty nice, and for some reason, the closets are enormous. (I briefly considered putting my desk into the walk-in closet in the spare bedroom.) I think the soundproofing is reasonably well-done, but we live over the show apartment, so I may be missing something. <br><br> <br><br>The management is good. It´s very hands-on; they tend to bug you a bit about things like leaving stuff outside and picking up after your dogs. <br><br> <br><br>Overall, I hope our next apartment is this nice. (We´re moving to the DC area.)

Leasing

Indulge yourself at Colonial Grand at Patterson Place apartment homes in Durham, NC. With architectural styling and undeniable beauty and charm, Colonial Grand at Patterson Place accommodates your desires in luxury apartment living. Situated in a beautifully landscaped setting in premier southwest Durham, residents enjoy easy access to Duke, UNC, I-40, I-85 and a host of shopping and dining. Come discover why Colonial Grand at Patterson Place is setting a new standard in luxury living!

Management Company: MAA

  • Monday - Friday: 09:00 AM - 06:00 PM
  • Saturday: 10:00 AM - 05:00 PM
